titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the American Studies at Yale University for Foreign Students Records
American Studies at Yale University for Foreign Students Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 08:45

did.unittitle: American Studies at Yale University for Foreign Students records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of reports, personnel files, printed materials, correspondence, and student rosters documenting student affairs, travel, employment, and publicity documenting American Studies at Yale University for Foreign Students program.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: American Studies at Yale University for Foreign Students

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 3-D (YRG 3-D), Records documenting academic support functions at Yale University

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: American Studies at Yale University for Foreign Students Records (RU 466). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: American Studies at Yale University for Foreign Students was established in 1948. The six-week program introduced individuals from other nations to the culture of the United States

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of reports, personnel files, printed materials, correspondence, and student rosters documenting student affairs, travel, employment, and publicity documenting American Studies at Yale University for Foreign Students program
